<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: One way to solve this problem is by using a temporary variable to store the first element before iterating over the rest of the elements. Here's an example:

String firstElement = it.next(); // store the first element
while (it.hasNext()) {
  String element = it.next();
  // process the elements
}

// Now you can pass the iterator to the method without losing the first element
methodAcceptingIterator(firstElement, it);
<<<explanation>>>: By storing the first element in a separate variable before iterating over the rest of the elements, you can still access the first element later on when needed. This allows you to pass the iterator to the method without losing the first element.
